ISSUE.TITLE: Fix cassandra user's HOME directory
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: See [this issue](https://github.com/k8ssandra/k8ssandra/issues/396) Essentially, now that Management API runs as the `cassandra` user, that user's effective HOME directory should exist and be writable by that user. We can either: 1) Create the default HOME directory of `/home/cassandra` and set the correct permissions, or 2) Run a `usermod` command to alter the home directory to `/opt/cassandra` which is already setup with correct permissions.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Update RestEasy libs to address CVEs

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Create home directory for cassandra user (#89) * Create home directory for cassandra user Create the `/home/cassandra` directory and make it writable for the `cassandra` user. This will allow files, including the cqlsh history, to be written for the user without warnings. Resolves #88
